info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 06 at 8:25PM EDT by NWS Greenville-Spartanburg
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northwestern Stephens, northeastern Habersham, central Rabun and west central Oconee Counties through 915 PM EDT... At 824 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 8 miles southeast of Clayton, or 5 miles northeast of Tallulah Gorge State Park, moving south at 10 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Clayton, Mountain City, Tiger, Tallulah Falls, Lakemont, Tallulah Gorge State Park, Black Rock Mountain State Park, Lake Rabun, Long Creek and Turnerville. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
